inn1.comm: short of a length, jagging in to the batsman, cutting him in half, thuds into Masakadza's thingh as he looks to play to the leg side
again, exaggerated movement into the right-hander, who can't get bat on it
moves in again, from short of a length, this time Masakadza gets bat on it and works it to midwicket
walks across outside off to negate the swing and gets it away fine, to square leg. First run on the board
short of a length again, moving in to the batsman, taps it to the leg side and gets off the mark
short of a length, tidy start from Kula. Masakadza tries to work it down the ground, not for runs.
faster than Kula, as one would expect, not much movement from short of a length on off stump. Played back down the pitch
short and slightly wide outside off, Taylor latches on to it and cuts it away cricply, but some sparkling fielding from Kapugedera at point, diving to his right, cuts the single
short and straight, hurries Taylor into the pull, he gets it away square for a poorly-timed pull, for a single
short of a length on leg stump, and tucked away deftly into the vacant midwicket, and they hustle across aiming for a second, but decide against it eventually

and Dilhara has struck, very strange shot from Taylor, who reacted to the short-of-length ball outside off, by backing away to the leg side, the way Chris Martin would have. It moved away off the seam, and in the end, he offered a limp nothing shot outside off, it kissed the edge and landed in Chandimal's gloves.
short again, good pace and lines from Fernando, pushes the batsman back as he taps it to the leg side
nicely bowled by Kula, he hits the McGrath line just outside off, planting seeds of doubt as Lamb forward-prods with no conviction, and misses
slightly shorter this time, and that allows Lamb to get back and punch it through the covers
cuts in from outside off, and Lamb manages to jab it away at the last moment to the off side
hint of movement outside off, draws the batsman forward and gets a thickish outside edge to third man
short and darting in from middle to leg, ball balloons off thigh pad to the leg side for a quick single
fuller this time, gets forward and blocks to the on side
short ball angling into Masakadza who looks assured in his pull-hoick, but the execution goes awry, and he shovels it off something to the right of the keeper and they run a single
outdone by pace, Lamb to the slaughter hangs in there and ducks as it whizzes past outside off
gets nicely behind this one, rises on his toes and works it with the wrists to midwicket
clocked at 140.9 kph, explodes from short of a length outside off and Masakadza smartly pulls out of the pull shot, Chandimal leaps and collects

right, Hamilton has had enough of being dictated to by Dilhara. He predicted another short ball, stayed put on the back foot and swung it away disdainfully over midwicket. Good shot to bring the first four of the day

smart comeback ball - Dilhara's patented split finger slower ball, in this case it is 130 kph, still a marked change in pace from his previous balls. Masakadza is early into the pull, swings and misses
worked away off the pads straight to short midwicket
short of a length again, tries to work it past that nagging man at short midwicket, who puts in a dive to his left to stop it
ooh, swings in sharply and catches the batsman plumb... but it was doing too much and was probably going to miss and go high
inward movement again, Lamb just about covers it and plays it back down the ground. The Lamb experiment has not worked so far
whipped away off the pads into the leg side, Lamb timed that reasonably well for a couple
short outside off, and pulled with a lot of aggression and no timing, it went slowly enough to mid on to permit a hurried single
opened up by the movement, gets a leading edge as he looks to whip it away, it goes behind square on the off side
fortuitious four runs. Makes room to the leg side and swings at it without much conviction towards the offside, gets an edge high over where first slip stands and it runs away for four to third man
tucked up by a tighter line outside off, he can't get it away for runs through the off side.
makes room to the leg side again, and looks to steer it fine through the leg side, but there is a man standing at a squarish short third man, who dives and saves a few runs
moving in to Lamb, who looks to score through the leg side, but gets neither placement nor timing
bouncer to finish the over, and Lamb ducks this time to let it go through to the keeper
tossed up on leg stump, nudged down to mid on for a quick single
freehit coming up, over-steps and lands it on leg stump, worked down to square leg
almighty hoick over midwicket, that tried and tested response to a free hit - does not work this time. Top edge balloons to Thissara Perera who is bemused after taking the catch. Not out, mate!

and Lamb holes out this time. Mendis continues to work on that short of a length area, on leg stump and Lamb goes for a sweep without much idea of what the ball is doing. The top edge loops up to square leg, where jeewan Mendis runs back to take a nice catch. Lamb has been doubly Mendis-ed, so to speak.
outside off and short of a length, he rocks back and cuts it between point and cover.
length ball, going through from off stump, gets forward and defends
straighter this time, angling across from leg to middle, Ervine looks to tip and run to the leg side, but does not succeed
whoa, bangs it in very short and very wide and gets it to swing away, would have gone straight to first slip if he were there. As it trasnpired, Chandimal collected the wide

short again and wide, Hamilton charges out and looks to blast it over long off, but does not middle it. Jeevan Mendis runs back from mid off, but does not put in the dive that may have given him one of the all-time classic catches
tucks him up on middle and leg, fended away to the leg side, it runs off the pads and they take a leg bye
short outside off, he rises with the bounce and looks to upper cut it, and gets it straight to third man
short of a length on off stump, tipped to the off side with very soft hands for a single
robust swipe from Masakadza, pre-meditates the sashay down the track again, and this time Thissara pitches it in his region, and he drives it past the diving mid off

whump! Perera shortens the length, expecting another jail break, but Hamilton out-foxes him, stays back and pulls it violently over midwicket. Timing all over that hit, it landed well back. 17 off the over
short of a length, cramping him for room outside off, misses the cut
beautifully disguised googly, slower and loopier than his usual stuff. Erwine is befuddled
picks it this time, and gets bat on it, just about, to the off side for a single
alow wrong un' turning from off down the leg side, Masakadza pre-meditated the lap-sweep and made no contact. Chandimal can't stop it either and they pick some byes
short and on leg stump, lets Erwine pull, but he does not time it. Gets a single
on leg stump, whipped away wide of midwicket, who puts in some quick yards to scupper thoughts of a quick single
whipped away against the turn off the back foot, to mid on for a quick single
whoa, turn and bounce from around the wicket, turning sharply towards the leg side, Masakadza gets something on it, down to short fine leg
grip and turn, right across Ervine, who surely prefers India's medium-pacers to this stuff
gets it away to the on side and turns the strike over
Masakadza walks all over Bulawayo, from outside leg to outside off and works it away with the spin, to square leg
defended towards point, not for runs.
loopy googly on middle, turned away to midwicket for an easy single, oh hang on, they are taking a rather manic second, the throw was not great and they make it
whipped away straight to square leg
rocks back and bunts this one down to wide long on for one
ooh, ripping flipping straighter one at 99.6 kph, raps him on the pads as he gets forward and there is a stifled appeal
down the track with no conviction, worked straight to midwicket for a risky single
turned away towards the leg side, but can't get it past midwicket
full on leg and straightening, raps him on the pads and Randiv clears his throat with a loud appeal
no clue about that one either, turns and hits something, but no where near his bat
swept with anger and intent, but can't get it past deep square leg
nearly succumbs to the leading edge, turns the face of the bat a little early and it pops up in the offside.
shortens the length, stays back and looks to score through the off side, but no luck
stays back again and forces it to the leg side with the spin, and they hare across for a couple
spin, across Ervine who is happy to survive this wonderful spell
loopy leggie outside off and he plays it to the leg side

Mendis has his man, it was always on the cards, and as was to be expected, it is that lethal googly of his doing the trick. Ervine came down the track, almost as if he was in a trance, rolled his head skywards and swung the bat towards midwicket, the ball duly turned away, took the outside edge and nestled in the hands of the lone slip fielder. Seeya later
wily two-finger googly from Mendis, misses the forward prod, misses the hurried back-foot movement towards the off side, and somehow misses off stump too. Epic bowling this.
gets outside off and laps it away to the leg side for a single
shortens the length, and turns in quickly, as Coventry dropped his plans of swinging it over midwicket and defended
shorter outside off, cut away square for a single
hit away towards midwicket for another single
whoa! By the law of averages, they had to time one of these swipes, and boy was that timed! Offie, spinning in to the right hander, Coventry was down on one knee and swung it high over cow corner
short leggie, wide outside off and pulled away to midwicket for a couple. Jeevan Mendis is the new bowler.
fuller and spinning away from the right-hander, very hustly style of bowling
turning away again, he gets back and whips it to the leg side for one
stays back and punches with the turn down to long on
swing and a miss, as it lands on leg and straightens, thuds into the back thigh, but that's not out
gets some pad on the attempted swipe to leg and it trickles away for a leg bye
short and straightening from off, whipped away off the backfoot, square to the leg side
short again, looks to work it off the back foot and bunts it for one to short midwicket
tossed up on the block-hole, driven down to long on
goes for a reverse sweep, and misses it completely. The keeper is also befuddled.

gone. Coventry was looking fidgety and wanted to dominate the spinners, this was in his slot and he looked to hit straight, but got too much elevation, at the cost of range, it went high and swirled around, before landing in Thissara Perera's safe hands
tossed up on off stump, tries to work it away again to the leg side, and does not beat the infield
tossed up on off stump, driven down to wide long off with the spin
holds it back, 71 kph on off stump, turning away, the batsman waits and waits before guiding it to the off side

ah! Tragedy this - Chigumbura is gone to one of the few bad balls on offer, and Jeevan Mendis has his maiden wicket with a rank bad long hop, Chigumbura went for the pull and got a bottom edge on to the stumps.
Tossed up outside off, gets forward and blocks;
short googly, gets back and forces it past the tumbling whort midwicket
nice bowling, tossed up on leg, and raps Masakadza on the pads

another one bites the dust.  Vicious turn from Randiv, from round the wicket, ripping across Blignaut from leg stump to off, beating the forward prod. It hit something, from first view it seemed like his thigh, and was pouched behind. The umpire reckoned it was an edge
tossed up on leg, looks to work it to the leg side and it loops to the short midwicket who runs across and has a shy, and concedes an overthrow
driven down the ground, towards long on for a single
shorter outside off, gets back and taps to the off side for one
on off stump, straightening into the batsman who works it to wide mid on

he's a gonner! Perfect offie's dismissal, that was tossed up outside off, eliciting the batsman to flick towards the legside, but leaving him complacent enough to do so without closing the bat-pad gap. It beat the shot, and snuck in to shatter the timber
stays back and drives it down to mid off
tossed up on leg, the batsman gets forward and defends
again, tight line on leg, turning towards off, defended
this one slips down the leg for a wide

and now a dream leggie's dismissal for Jeevan Mendis! Beautiful, ripping legspinner turning across from leg stump and defeating the forward prod. The batsman over-balanced on the front foot and Chandimal whipped the bails off in far lesser time than it takes to read out BMAJ Mendis' full name
tossed up googly, gets forward and defends from middle stump line
short of a length outside off, driven down the track of the back foot
short of a length outside off, tapped down with soft hands for a quick single.
risky single, tapped straight to point, who shied at the stumps and missed
full outside off, Masakadza walks down the track and plays it away to the leg side for two to bring up a fine fifty.
straight outside off and Masakadza is at it again, scurrying across the stumps to work it to the leg side, and does not make contact. Loud appeal, but he was entirely outside off when it struck him
full on leg, Masakadza taps it away with the intention of taking a strike-retaining single. As they would say in Madras, he did over-gaaji. Can't blame him too.
tossed up outside off, gets forward and defends
comes down the track this time, and defends to the off side
short this time, and he can't capitalise cutting it straight to cover.
short again, stays back and pull-punches it down to long on
Price gets forward and guides it with the leg spin, square to the off side
pitched up on leg stump, and Masakadza tried to send it flying out of the ground, but could not get enough bat on it. Trickles off the bottom edge to short fine leg
whipped away with the wrists to midwicket
short of a length outside off, uncertain prod to the offside, no run
tossed up, googly, Price picks it, gets forward and blocks
pitched up again, driven meekly straight to mid off
shortens the length outside off, and misses the attempted guide to the off side, by a whisker
tossed up on off and middle, gets forward and defends down the track
slow full toss, decieves Hamilton who somehow connects with his hoick and gets it over the infield, through to the square leg fence
makes room by moving to the leg side and swings hard, making no contact
down the track this time, and looks to drill it down the ground, but makes no contact. Hint of away movement, takes it away from the outside edge
out of the crease again, yorks himself and gets some inside edge and pad on it, as it runs away to the leg side
bouncer, Price was expecting it, stayed back and pulled it into the ground for a single
low full toss on leg, Masakadza drives hard to long on and labours across for a second. A better throw would have caught him short
full toss on leg stump, worked straight to square leg
short of a length on middle and off, bunted down to long on to give Masakadza the strike
played away to the off side, can't find the gap
down the track and driven hard straight to long on
short of a length on legstump, whipped away to midwicket and they scurry for a couple
Price goes for a reverse sweep, what a stud! And misses, and it is called a wide as it slips down the leg. Moral victory for the batsman, Not.
And now the violence, he pulls out the slog sweep, off the last ball of Powerplay, straight to long leg for one
short of a length outside off, comes out of the crease and swings it to long on for one
good bouncer, cramping the batsman and he lets it go outside off
big swing of the bat to the full ball, towards the leg side, he's created a strong breeze across the ground, but misses the ball

Masakadza's effort has come to an end, thanks to another smart bouncer from Fernando. He was looking to get forward, and was taken by surprise by the short one, but went through with the pull. It looped over midwicket, and Kulasekara running back, took a good catch and tumbled over backwards.
another bouncer, this one takes off and goes very high, it is called wide

Fitting end to an innings full of fits and starts. Price looks to shovel the full ball to the leg side, and the comedy of errors begins with his leading edge that takes it high towards the covers. Jeevan Mendis runs in miles from the boundary and dives forward, but fails to collect the catch. Price is keen on farming the strike and looks to take a second, and Perera notices he is halfway down, and lobs a throw to the bowler who breaks the stumps.

inn2.comm: sliding down the leg, gets some pad on it and it trickles fine for four leg byes
full on off stump, defended down to mid off
ooh, pitched up and a hint on inward movement into the left-hander, who picks the movement and drives down straight
slightly shorter, again moves in, driven confidently and it is cut off by mid off
very short bouncer, was close to being called a wide, but it made the cut for a legal delivery

pitched up, and Tharanga jumps out to drive it to the offside and nearly pierces the gap. Agile fielding from mid off running to his right denies him runs. Decent start from Mpofu barring the first ball
beauty ball, opens up Dilshan and strikes him on the back foot, the appeal is turned down but that was close
fuller, Dilshan gets forward and drives to the off side
short again, and sliding on to leg stump, worked away to the leg side
stays back and guides it to the off side to get off the mark
short of a length, turning in and offering Tharanga just enough width to free his arms and cut it through the off side, along the carpet
stays back and works it away with the turn to the leg side
pitched up outside off and smashed in the air, just over the head of point for a boundary
over-pitched again, and whacked off the front foot straight to short cover
shortens the length and Tharanga gets forward and blocks down the ground
short and Tharanga was adept to swivel on the back foot and control the pull shot down to square leg
slower ball, short of a length outside off, Tharanga picked it early and opened the face and guided it neatly to the square boundary
short and wide and smashed away in the air, over the infield and it thuds into the boundary boards at the point  boundary. Tharanga is up and running.
tossed up outside off from wide of the crease, and driven off the front foot
slips on to leg stump, played away watchfully to midwicket
cramped for room on off stump, patted down the track
ooh, steals a tight leg bye to square leg, and would have been knackered by a better throw to the non-striker's end
short of a length outside off, stays back and cracls it through point, yet again, for a boundary
pitched up on off, Tharanga gets forward and flicks it straight to long on for one
pitched up at a friendly pace of 122 kph outside off, Tharanga gets forward and drives through the covers
pitched up and a shade of away movement, Dilshan opens the face and gets it behind point
slow, short and wide outside off, so innocous that Tharanga handled it carefully
short of a length, gets some bounce as Tharanga is surprised after coming down the track. Defends it to the off side
full on off stump, stays back and opens the face to get it away to point
eat all you can offer from Blignaut and Dilshan tucks in. Short and straying wide down the leg, Dilshan pulls it fine en route to the fine leg fence
pitched up on off, turns away, Tharange plays the forward defensive
shorter this time and straighter, tapped down to mid on
offie from wide of the crease, over the wicket, Dilshan looks to sweep and it runs to short fine leg
short and a fraction wide, Dilshan cuts away without much timing, but threads the gap between point and cover and they run across for three
tossed up outside off, looks to cut but can't get it away for runs
back of a length, at 126 kph, pushes Dilshan back and it taps it to midwicket for a quick single
short and wide outside off, Tharanga rises with the bounce and cuts it away to the deep
short of a length, angling into Dilshan who plays it watchfully, keeping it down and safe from short midwicket
and Dilshan pulls out the wallop. It was slow and sat up off a length, not giving Dilshan any pace to work with and he pull-shovelled it over midwicket
and again, this time he gets more bat on it. Over the leg side infield
another whack to the leg side, a hint of inside edge as it tailed it, it runs down to square leg
Tharanga is in prime cutting form, and Zim's spinners are letting him do it often. Short and wide, see you later.
pitched up on leg, he can't drive it down to the leg side
length ball, on middle and turning across, played away watchfully to the off side
tossed up on leg, turned away to the leg side for a quick single
super shot, Dilshan comes down the track and says what he thinks about it. He gets to the pitch of the ball, goes inside out and it flies away partly in the air through the covers to the boundary
pitched up on leg, a hint of leading edge as it is played back to the bowler
a hint of turn outside off, Tharanga opens the face expertly and runs it very fine for three runs
big spin on that offie, Dilshan was looking to cut and was caught by surprise as it darted in. Managed to keep it away
pitched up, Dilshan gets forward and taps to the off side
another hit-me ball and Dilshan does the needful, cut it away fine for four

and now the slog-sweep. It was pitched up and turning in, Dilshan cared little about the spin, got down on one knee and swung it high between the midwicket-long leg gap, couple of bounces for four. Sri lanka are coasting.
slow loopy offspinner, Tharanga stays back and punches straight to cover
pitched up on leg, flicked straight to midwicket
stays back and plays it off the middle stump line towards the covers
looks to cut from wide outside off and misses
That's the Dilshan we know. Rushes down the track in a flurry of legs, gets to the pitch and smashes it high over the straight boundary. Quick feet, quick hands, that's Dilshan for you.
Dilshan is in a hurry here. Pitched up on middle and leg, he launches that with a nice free swing over midwicket, coupla bounces for four
short and cut away for a single
turns from middle to off, from short of a length, Tharanga opens the face and runs it fine for a triple
short again, their scared of Dilshan's rush down the track, he cuts it to the right of point

that's the only way it looked like a wicket would fall. Tharanga gets forward and plays it straight to cover and calls his captain across for a single. Dilshan did not seem interested, and Tharanga was half way down the pitch when the fielder swooped in and fired a throw to the keeper. Curtains for Tharanga
length ball turning from off to leg, defended carefully to the leg side
lashed away by the best lasher of 'em all. Wide outside off and Dilshan does not bother with the trifles of footwork, just reaches out and laces that one through the covers
shorter and closer to the stumps, but no problems for Dilshan who generates enough bat speed to send that hurtling behind point for another four
slow bouncer, 109 kph, it was slow enough for Dilshan to have a cup of tea and come back to play, but he waited and waited and then missed the upper cut
swing and a miss to the leg side, through to the keeper
sliding down the leg and Dilshan cannot capitalise, it runs off his pads for a leg bye
pitched up on middle and leg, played watchfully to the leg side
short and pulled away comfortably to the leg side, Dilshan brings up an easy fifty. Price troubled him a bit early on, since then it has been smooth sailing
short and slow leggie, easily played away to mid on
another short ball, and Dilshan pulls it very hard into the deep for a single
another short ball, this is ordinary bowling at its most ordinary. Pulled away high and handsome for four
short again, but turning to the offside, he goes for the cut but for no runs.
well... another rank long hop, the batsman pounced on it and pulled it fine of square leg, where the fielder made a mess of a regulation stop.
short of a length outside off, cuts it away to the covers
hit back viciously, on the bounce to the bowler
short this time, pulls it fine behind square for a single
attempted bouncer goes awry, slips down the leg side and it is called wide
short and wide outside off, Dilshan swishes hard at it and makes no contact
full and slipping down the leg, he has bowled all over the place in this over. Dilshan has no clue what is coming next. I reckon, neither does Chigumbura
lashes at the full ball outside off and gets it into the outfield at cover
short of a length outside off, looks to cut and bottom edges it away to point for one
speared in from wide of the crease, cuts away into the off side for a single
worked off the pads into the leg side and they run hard for a couple
worked away off the pads again for another single
full on midde stump, hurries the batsman back and he plays it back with straight bat
full on leg, and he cannot get the sweep past short fine leg
short of a length outside off, looks to cut and misses
swung away to the leg side for a couple. Scores are level.

fitting finish. Bouncer that flies high over Dilshan's head and wide down the leg side, so it is wide on two counts. Sri Lanka have five points, and Zimbabwe are down from first on the table, to last.
